title: RuPaul's Drag Race star Tatianna arrested for disorderly conduct
text:
RuPaul's Drag Race star Tatianna has been arrested for disorderly conduct.

The drag queen, born Joey Santolini, was arrested on Sunday in Atlanta, after causing a disturbance at a nightclub, as first reported by TMZ.

Police sources told the website that Tatianna had been outside the club when she was approached by a member of staff, who snapped her picture, then went back inside through a staff only door.

Underarrest: RuPaul's Drag Race star Tatianna was arrested for disorderly conduct after she 'used staff-only door at nightclub' then refused to leave; she is seen in her mugshot on Sunday

Conflict: The officers apparently asked Tatianna to leave the building, and after she refused she was placed in handcuffs and arrested

Tatianna followed, but was asked to leave and use the main door.

When she ignored the request, police were called. The officers asked Tatianna to leave the building, and after she refused she was placed in handcuffs and arrested.

Longtime fans of RuPaul's Drag Race will remember Tatianna from season 2 in 2010, in which she was a fan favourite.

Known for her youth - she was just 21 at the time - she came fourth in the season.

TV star: RuPaul's Drag Race star Tatianna is seen in 2016

Popular: Longtime fans of RuPaul's Drag Race will remember Tatianna from season 2 in 2010, in which she was a fan favourite

The drag queen is now a regular on the celebrity circuit, partying at the VMAs this past August.

And Tatianna even appeared in Taylor Swift's video for You Need To Calm Down back in June.

She played Ariana Grande in the video, alongside some of her fellow RPDR alums, including Adore Delano, Trinity the Tuck and A'keria C Davenport.

They appeared on a stage impersonating pop icons like Beyoncé, Nicki Minaj and Adele.
description: RuPaul's Drag Race star Tatianna has been arrested for disorderly conduct.
